climbs.name: Sunshine
climbs.fa: FA on TR: Bob Clark June 1980  FA on lead: Chad Hussey, Sam Slater, Ken Nichols, June 1982

content.description: Somewhat meandering face climb left of the chimney. The business begins in the 'hole' (concavity where it gets steeper) and is fairly sustained until the top-out.
content.location: 10 feet or so left of the chimney, there's a small-ish corner - that's the start. Work up to the ledge, into the hole and out toward the right to top out.

content.description: Climb the wide crack/chimney in the corner that narrows as you ascend.  A fun toprope that doesn't get climbed as much as it deserves. On hot summer days, a cool breeze flows out of the crack.
content.protection: Tough to protect.  You have to really hunt for pro.  Bring your monster cams and micro nuts, but small cams seem to fit best.  Don't fall.  Suitable trees for top-rope anchors.  Walk off right.
content.location: The right facing corner at the junction of the Entertainer and Cracked Walls.

content.description: Start up the face between the left-facing corner (Sunshine) and the right edge of the wall (Narrowing Experience). After the second horizontal crack, diagonal up and left over a small alcove to an old chopped bolt. Straight up from there.
content.protection: Requires gear to set up top-rope anchor.  Walk off right.

content.description: Start on the face a few feet to the right of the small left-facing corner in the middle of the wall.  Climb up to first ledge and then head left and up past an old bolt hole.  Continue more-or-less straight up to the top.
content.protection: Requires gear to set up toprope anchor.  Hang it further out toward the arete than you think.

content.description: A nice, easy lead.  Follow the arete to a ramp tending right.  You can start on the ledge or from the path below for a bit of extra climbing.
content.protection: Protects well except for some easy moves at the start.
content.location: The arete between Right Wing and Entertainer walls.  Walk off right using climbers trail.

content.description: Nearly vertical face to the left of Cracked Wall.
